message_1: Solve the inequality 4x - 5 > 11 for x, then graph the solution set on a number line.
message_2:
To solve the inequality 4x - 5 > 11, follow these steps:

Step 1: Add 5 to both sides of the inequality.
4x - 5 + 5 > 11 + 5
4x > 16

Step 2: Divide both sides by 4.
4x/4 > 16/4
x > 4

The solution to the inequality is x > 4.

To graph the solution set on a number line:

1. Draw a number line with the numbers 0 to 8, for example.
2. Locate the number 4 on the number line.
3. Since x > 4, we want all the values greater than 4. To represent this, draw an open circle at 4 (because 4 is not included in the solution set) and draw an arrow pointing to the right from the open circle, indicating that all the numbers greater than 4 are part of the solution set.
